attributes.action: Mandatory Life Skills and Financial Education in UK Schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Our school system is failing to prepare young people for real life. Children are leaving school without the basic knowledge they need to manage as adults things like how to open a bank account, budget money, apply for a mortgage, or find stable work. These are essential skills every person needs, yet they’re rarely taught in classrooms.
At the same time,neurodivergent children (those with autism, ADHD and dyslexia) are too often misunderstood, unsupported, or pushed out of mainstream education
attributes.background:
We’re asking the Government to:

1. Make practical life skills education a mandatory part of the national curriculum.

2. Provide mandatory neurodiversity training for all teachers and school staff, so they can properly support neurodivergent pupils.

rejection.details:
The Government has announced that they are making reforms to the national education curriculum. This includes ensuring all pupils learn financial literacy and financial skills.

You can read more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-curriculum-to-give-young-people-the-skills-for-life-and-work
